title: Federated Edge Learning: Digital-Based Wireless Communication and Optimization Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Emphasizing balance between hands-on practice using personal devices and theoretical foundations, including workplace application cases for professionals

learning_goals: One can explain communication bottlenecks occurring in wireless multi-access environments
One can design model optimization procedures utilizing 1-bit quantization and QAM-based digital aggregation methods
One can mathematically model the impact of wireless environmental variables (channel noise/fading) on learning convergence rates
One can analyze the advantages and disadvantages of digital implementation methods in federated edge learning systems compared to conventional analog approaches
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
